IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we need to connect a new substation to the network for electric vehicle electricity supplies. This equipment controls and delivers electricity into your area. This work is being carried out at night to minimise disruption due to traffic management requirements on site. To connect the new equipment and complete the work safely, we need to turn your power off. Once completed this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in your area and reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future. This work is taking place on Thorney Way.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We regularly inspect our electrical equipment to ensure it is safe and efficient. We need to examine 2 transformers on our electricity poles to check they are functioning properly. This essential work helps to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power cuts in the future as we appreciate some customers may have experienced unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your electricity. We are taking extra measures to limit the time your power is off and we'll do our best to cause as little disruption as possible. Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future. This work is taking place near Butchers Lane and Homefield.

Steps.Message:
Sent by David at 22:05 - We're sorry your power has gone off again. We are sending our engineers back to the Nicholls Close area to investigate why.

Currently, our time frame for power to be restored is between 01:30 and 02:30, but once our staff arrive on site and assess the situation, this time may change. As there have been other power cuts recently it's difficult to know what repairs will be needed to restore your power safely, so time frames we provide throughout have to be estimated.

The results of our engineer's tests on our network will let us know if our estimate needs to be adjusted, so we'll update you as soon as they have arrived on site and investigated.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Power cut alert from UK Power Networks at [TIME]. We're letting you know about an unplanned power cut affecting 1/3 of properties in [postcode]. Not all customers will be affected, and you may still have power. Get live updates on our website: https://www.ukpowernetworks.co.uk/power-cut/ To verify who we are, you can access the above page by Googling UK Power Networks. We notify our Priority Service Customers of outages 24 hours a day. If you need extra help or support, please call us on 08003163105.

Logs.Comment:
Sent by David at 22:05 - We're sorry your power has gone off again. We are sending our engineers back to the Nicholls Close area to investigate why.

Currently, our time frame for power to be restored is between 01:30 and 02:30, but once our staff arrive on site and assess the situation, this time may change. As there have been other power cuts recently it's difficult to know what repairs will be needed to restore your power safely, so time frames we provide throughout have to be estimated.

The results of our engineer's tests on our network will let us know if our estimate needs to be adjusted, so we'll update you as soon as they have arrived on site and investigated.

Power cut alert from UK Power Networks at [TIME].

We're letting you know about an unplanned power cut affecting 1/3 of properties in [postcode]. Not all customers will be affected, and you may still have power.

Get live updates on our website: https://www.ukpowernetworks.co.uk/power-cut/

To verify who we are, you can access the above page by Googling UK Power Networks.

We notify our Priority Service Customers of outages 24 hours a day. If you need extra help or support, please call us on 08003163105.

PlannedIncidentReason: We're carrying out planned work in your area. For our engineers to carry it out safely they need to turn the power off. We're doing this work as it's essential to provide reliable electricity supplies to your area. We're sorry for any inconvenience caused and thank you for your patience.
MainMessage: We are aware of an incident caused by LV Fuse Replacement/Linking affecting the electricity supply in your area. Steps.Message:
Sent by David at 22:47 - Engineers are on their way. At this point we think the issue is a fault with equipment in your local substation in the Eastfield Road area. We didn't know this was going to happen, so time frames we provide throughout are estimated and are subject to change.

Our estimated time to have power back on is currently between 02:00 and 03:00, but after we arrive and assess the situation this may change. The reason for this is there can sometimes be a more complex underlying issue found by our engineer's tests which may take longer, and if not we may get power back on sooner.

All of our texts are written and sent personally by our team, and we'll let you know once our staff arrive.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Decasta at 19:35 - I'm pleased to confirm that all power in the Pleasant Road area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected underground cabling fault, which our engineers have now repaired.

We know that a power cut can be difficult, and I'm sorry for the length of the time you were without your electricity. Please rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Thanks for bearing with us during the power cut today, our staff will work to restore your power as quickly and as safely as possible. A lot of our customers have questions regarding power cuts, and though you can always reach our team, you can also find some helpful information and answers to some of our most frequently asked questions on our website here - https://bit.ly/3pTfAz9 - Bear in mind this will use your mobile data, so feel free to speak to us if you'd prefer. We'll be in touch again once we have more information from our staff.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have just called in to advise us that excavations are ongoing to expose the faulty underground cable for repairs.

Unfortunately, it's going to take us past our current time frame to complete this safely, so we're now working towards between 18:30-19:30 to have power back on.

We can appreciate how frustrating and disruptive being without power can be, and our staff are working as fast as they can. If you have any questions or concerns, please feel free to speak to our team, but I'll let you know further news as it comes in from site. Sent by Decasta at 16:21.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Decasta at 18:39 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers repair a fault on the underground network in the Cherry Hinton Road area. We have now restored power to all but one property. We're sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused. The customer support vehicle has stood down and further repairs will be carried out.

If your power isn't back on, we'd still like to keep you updated. If we aren't currently in contact with you by phone or in person at your property, please call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power for a long time can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Decasta at 16:50 - Our engineers have advised us that in order to continue their works on the underground fault safely, they have had to turn off power to further properties in the area. Our estimated time of 20:30-21:30 hasn't changed. If you'd like more information about why we sometimes have to switch power off to work; here's a short video https://bit.ly/3cYez0V. We'll keep you updated with progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our customer support vehicle is now on site. It's located outside of 110 Cherry Hinton road and is ready to provide extra support to anyone affected by the power cut.

If you have someone in your property or know of someone who needs extra care or cannot travel to the vehicle, please let us know by calling 08003163105 or tweet us @UKPowerNetworks. Sent by Decasta at 15:11.

We're doing this work as it's essential to provide reliable electricity supplies to your area. We're sorry for any inconvenience caused and thank you for your patience.
MainMessage: We have repaired the problem with the electricity supply in your area. There may still be some tidying up to do, and any details have been passed to our Maintenance department, who will attend to it as soon as possible. Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message: We became aware of a power cut at 20:25. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly.
Steps.Name: Reported

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Power back on

Steps.Message:
Sent by Luke at 13:25 - We can now confirm that all power in the Hook Road area should be back on. The issue was caused by a piece of faulty underground  equipment, which our engineers have replaced.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our team of specialist engineers have now begun to arrive to locate and fix the underground equipment fault.

At the moment we don't need to change our estimated time frame, and we'll continue to keep you updated with all of our progress as it comes in from site. Sent by Lisa at 12:20.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Luke at 10:21 - Thanks for bearing with us, we know being without power can be frustrating. I'll be on hand to update you as our staff work on repairs, and I just wanted to give you the latest from site.

Our staff have been in contact with us and advised they need assistance from further staff. They are working to check smaller sites along our network, known as link boxes. These have very heavy metal lids, and for safety our engineer needs further staff to help.

To allow time for further staff to arrive and for any repairs to be made, we're now estimating power will be on by 18:00 and 19:00. I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Adam at 11:08 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 83 customers in the Hall Road area, by diverting power around the underground network fault. We understand how difficult a power cut can be, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have arrived on site in the Hall Road area to investigate the power cut affecting 83 properties.

Specialist engineers are also working to divert power remotely, and this can cause your lights to go on and off.

We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. Sent by Adam at 10:45.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Adam at 10:09 - Our engineers are on their way. At this point we think the issue is an underground network fault affecting 83 properties.

Specialist engineers from our control room are also working to divert power remotely, so it's possible your power could come back on at any point. We can't always restore everyone this way. That's why we're also sending staff to the area to check our equipment.

Every fault is different, so our time frames have to be estimated but currently we hope to have power back on between 11:30 and 12:30. We must stress that it may become necessary for this to change, depending on what our engineers find.

We'll keep you updated with our progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 09:31. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically

Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Power back on

Sent by Decasta at 17:22 - Thanks for your patience today. Our engineers have now repaired the faulty equipment and re-erected a low hanging overhead cable, and have deemed it safe to restore power back to all 62 properties in the NR18 9 area.

We're very sorry we had to turn your power off unexpectedly, and with so little warning. We usually provide much more notice if we can, but in a situation like this our first priority is the safety of the public and our staff.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. If your power is still off or if you have any questions, call our team on 08003163105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Decasta at 16:08 - We're very sorry we've had to switch off your electricity. Our engineers have turned off the power in the NR18 9 area for safety so they can repair faulty overhead network equipment. Our estimated time to have your power back on is between 17:30-18:30, however, this may need to change later depending on how our works progress. If you'd like more information about why we sometimes have to switch power off to work; here's a short video https://bit.ly/3cYez0V. We'll keep you updated with progress.

Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

We can appreciate how frustrating and disruptive being without power can be, and our staff are working as fast as they can. If you have any questions or concerns, please feel free to speak to our team, but I'll let you know further news as it comes in from site. Sent by Decasta at 17:41.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Luke at 12:57 - Our engineers are on their way. At this point we think the issue is an overhead fault affecting 135 properties.

Specialist engineers from our control room are also working to divert power remotely, so it's possible your power could come back on at any point. We can't always restore everyone this way. That's why we're also sending staff to the area to check our equipment.

Every fault is different, so our time frames have to be estimated but currently we hope to have power back on between 16:00 and 17:00. We must stress that it may become necessary for this to change, depending on what our engineers find.

We'll keep you updated with our progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage affects multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you expect. We're arranging staff to attend ASAP, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting electricity. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to get as many customers back on as we can.

Once available, our engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, they will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will work to locate the issue and make repairs, which may take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing but we'll always give you the clearest information we have.
